description: Football superstar David Beckham has received his knighthood from King Charles at a ceremony in Windsor Castle. title: Could killing net zero save the Coalition? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: We want to hear from you! Please complete our survey: 2025 ABC News Daily Audience Survey (https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=mkDBl3hw50e7lNHlNQPgEpOxE0YscZ5Au4rK0pnU0zpURUxPU0ZaM0g0M1NaSEg4QVFVUFFKMVc4Uy4u)    The Coalition’s climate policies have been under review since its drubbing at the last election.   But now that the Nationals have struck first, deciding to abandon a commitment to reach net zero emissions by 2050, there’s big pressure on Sussan Ley’s leadership of the Liberal Party.   Will the Liberals follow their Coalition partner? And what would it mean for their electoral prospects and the signal it sends about the two parties’ enthusiasm for climate action?   Today, Michelle Grattan, the chief political correspondent at The Conversation, on the history of the Coalition’s climate policy and what happens next.   Featured:   Michelle Grattan, chief political correspondent at The Conversation and a professorial fellow at the University of Canberra

title: One in 10 homebuyers in October accesses 5% deposit scheme | ABC NEWS
description: One in 10 residential properties sold in October were purchased through the federal government’s 5 per cent home deposit scheme, new government data shows.  The Albanese government insists the expansion of its housing policy is working and is not substantially driving up prices, despite figures from Coality showing a 1.1 per cent increase in national home values in the same month. Shadow Housing Minister Andrew Bragg has described the scheme as ‘reckless’, arguing it propels demand for housing in a market already burdened with a supply crisis.  Federal Housing Minister Clare O’Neil has defended the policy, highlighting the difference it has made to many young people while maintaining it has not caused a significant impact on property prices.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-11-05/one-in-10-homes-bought-using-government-incentive-in-october/105976010  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Pocock slams government over leaky roof housing $5bn national collection | ABC NEWS
description: The National Gallery of Australia has forewarned of rolling closures for repairs that will shut the public out of the institution.  In its latest annual report, the gallery also said it was not funded to complete the breadth of works required, including fixing leaks in the roof.   That is despite Prime Minister Anthony Albanese visiting the NGA in April 2023 and heralding a solution.   "We should see a priority on these institutions, a priority on Canberra," Independent ACT senator David Pocock said. title: Ukraine and Russia locked in fight for strategic city of Pokrovsk | ABC NEWS
description: Ukraine has been locked in a months-long battle to defend the eastern city of Pokovsk. Russia claims it's making gains towards the strategic centre with Moscow deploying up to 100,000 troops to the area. The Kremlin sees Pokrovsk as a gateway to capturing the entire Donbas region, one of its key aims of the long-running war.
